channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OOZIE-2400] Workflow xml configuration parser cannot deal with namespace prefix
item.description:
When running a java action and a spark action via an oozie workflow xml, the xml contains multiple namespaces (e.g. uri:oozie:workflow:0.5 and uri:oozie:spark-action:0.1).
Thus the elements need to be prefixed by the namespace prefix. But when running this workflow, the configuration parser throws the exception "JA009: bad conf file: top-level element not <configuration>".

The bug is located in class org.apache.oozie.util.XConfiguration in methods "parseDocument(Document doc)" and "processNodes(Element root)". The xml tags here are retrieved via "getTagName()", (which gets the full tag name) and compared against string constants like "configuration". So this fails in case the tag contains a namespace prefix and it seems there is no workaround!

Here is an easy fix for this. All calls of "getTagName()" in these 2 methods can be replaced by "getLocalName()".
item.summary: Workflow xml configuration parser cannot deal with namespace prefix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch for this issue
See attached path file OOZIE-2400-1.patch.

After all there is a workaround for this problem using a namespace prefix-less XML formed the way you can see in this example:
http://oozie.apache.org/docs/4.2.0/DG_SparkActionExtension.html

But note, this is just a workaround, not the solution. XML containing namespace prefixes is absolutely valid XML.

Patch looks good to me +1 (non-binding) and it'd be great to get this in.

But as mentioned there is a workaround. Oozie should still work with valid XML.

The full output of the test-patch run is available at

. https://builds.apache.org/job/oozie-trunk-precommit-build/2634/
Trying to submit patch again so Jenkins can run again

I couldn't get Jenkins to run again but I did run all these tests manually and they either succeed, don't exist anymore or also fail for me without the patch. So I think the failures are/were unrelated and this should be ready to be committed if there are no objections.

I'm not sure I'd call this a bug and the namespace prefix-less XML a workaround. That's the expected way of writing workflow XMLs. Users usually complain about Oozie's XML being too verbose, not the other way around

I suppose that as long as the existing namespace prefix-less XML still works with the patch, we should fix this; as you both pointed out, this is also valid XML.

Feedback on the patch:

  • In the test, we should use a try-finally to make sure the InputStream is always closed
  • Missing newline at the end of the XML file
  • I did a quick grep of "getTagName" and found that OozieCLI also has some of these, where it copied some code from XConfiguration. We should fix this there as well.
  • I also took a quick look at the JavaDoc for getLocalName. Looks like it has some conditions where it can return null. Are we 100% sure that this case can't happen here? We don't want an NPE.

Robert, thanks for the feedback. As long as we get this in we don't care whether we call it a bug or a feature

I have attached a new patch that addresses all your comments.

I did some research and as far as I can tell the method only returns null for DOM Level 1 parsers and it seems that setting the parser to be namespace aware is enough to make it DOM Level 2 or 3. I have to admit that the documentation could be clearer.

Thanks lars_francke.
Committed to trunk! (after removing the trailing whitespace)
Thanks rkanter for helping us get this in
Thank you both very much for solving this issue!
Closing issue; Oozie 4.3.0 is released.
